text.text: Working with Charges categories

text: Charge rates are entered on the Charges tab under Settings and departmentalized into groups called categories. Categories are a grouping of rates for a specific purpose. For charges that differ from the Universal rates ( your default rates ) , create a new category. You can have as many categories as you need.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text:

text.text: help me work with charges categories.

text: To get to the Charges tab, click Settings on the navigation bar. Before you start entering rates, let's learn a little more about charge categories. Categories are a grouping of rates for a specific purpose. For charges that differ from the Universal rates (your default rates), create a new category. You can have as many categories as you need.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text.text: Ignoring a Claim on a Facility Invoice

text: Ignoring a claim on a facility invoice will ignore the claim on the invoice and keep the charge and new balance the same. The claim will not be invoiced and will not display under the "Previously Invoiced Claim Summary".
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=b5m2qc0mtu

text.text: What is facility billing.

text: Facility billing is an agreement with a facility for a dollar amount that the facility will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=zq9lkfn31i

text.text: How to fix an incorrect facility charge?

text: To fix an incorrect facility charge, you can: 1. Go to the Claim page for the submitted claim 2. Click the Charges tab and then click the edit icon 3. Update the charge ( s ) on the Claim page 4. Click Save changes 5. Click Resubmit to payer 6. Click the Facilities on the top navigation bar 7. Click the Queued claims tab 8. Click the edit icon next to the ' Invoice period ' field and select the correct date 9. Click Generate invoice
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=hlsxcylp49

text.text: How to invoice outstanding balance?

text: To invoice outstanding balance, you can click the With outstanding balances tab to see the facility information, any new charges, and the outstanding balance. The outstanding balance is the total amount of charges invoiced to this facility minus discounts (contractual allowances).
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=2wu3qwpf0s

text.text: What is PCS-Part 2

text: The Physician Certification Statement (PCS) is the written order certifying the medical necessity of non-emergency ambulance transports.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=4gybbygyz7

text.text: How to set up diagnosis favorites?

text: To set up diagnosis favorites, you can manually create a list by following these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, select **Settings**. 2. On the Settings page, click the **Diagnosis favorites** tab. 3. On the search field, enter a partial description or the ICD-10 code. As you type, a list appears. Select the code from the list. 4. The code displays under the search bar. Adding a nickname to the code is optional but if done, allows users to search for codes using the nickname when assigning codes to a claim.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=f6fj0yksql

text.text: Explain ICD-10 Expiration Dates.

text: As ICD-10 expires codes, they will no longer be available in ZOLL Billing. If you have an ICD-10 code that was valid for the date of service of your claim and you change the date of service to one where the ICD-10 code is no longer valid, it will not display in ZOLL Billing.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=up4i0i1p9w

text.text: What is ICD-10 Expiration Dates?

text: ICD-10 diagnosis codes are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, ICD-10 diagnosis codes are added when a primary payer is created. When you move from a primary payer to the secondary/tertiary payer, the ICD-10 diagnosis codes from the primary payer are copied to the secondary/tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want. Changes to ICD-10 diagnosis codes will persist for that payer only. After you change ICD-10 diagnosis codes for a specific payer, it is always a good practice to check them for the current payer before you submit the claim.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=up4i0i1p9w

text.text: How to Change the primary payer after payment?

text:
Sure, I can help you with that.

After payment, you can change the primary payer by following these steps:

1. Click the Credit tab on the Claim page.
2. Find the credit block with the name or the ignored original payer.
3. Click Refund payment.
4. Enter the transaction type, number, and date.
5. Click Post now.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=mez18bi5ct
